explanation: The original if-line compared characters for equality (S1[0] == S2[0] or S1[1] == S2[1]), which incorrectly treats matching '.' as a connection. The correct logic is: the configuration is disconnected only when there are exactly two black squares and they are on opposite corners (diagonally). I replaced the condition with one that counts '#' and checks for the diagonal-two case, then negates it so we print "Yes" when connected. (This fixes the mistaken equality check by explicitly testing for '#'.)
